application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The proposed materials to the roof of the proposed rear dormer roof extension use are not robust or appropriate for use in a Conservation Area and would not preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Fishponds Conservation Area. The proposal would therefore detract and fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Conservation Area and would conflict with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 DM10 and DM12 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012 and the guidance in the Council's Residential Design Guide SPD 2013 and the NPPF (2021).

The proposed siting and design of the proposed rear dormer roof extension to the rear elevation, including the design and number of of proposed roof lights to the front elevation in relation to the rear dormer roof extension,  would represent a development that is not characteristic with the established pattern of development within the streetscene or surrounding area; and would detract and fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Fishponds Conservation Area.  The proposal would therefore conflict with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policies CS8 DM10 and DM12 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012 and the guidance in the Council's Residential Design Guide SPD 2013 and the NPPF (2021).
description: Demolition of existing rear conservatory and shed, erection of single storey rear extension and rear dormer roof extension, installation of 3nos front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion. Erection of boundary wall and gate with hardstanding in front and rear garden.
